quantityRules.description: Single turtle requires 75 gallons minimum (48√ó24√ó18 inches). Each additional turtle requires 25 more gallons. Adults need 120+ gallons.

lifespan: 20-40 years in captivity, can live 50+ years
setupTips: Provide powerful canister filter - turtles are messy eaters
Basking platform must be completely dry and easily accessible
Use submersible heater to maintain water temperature 75-80¬∞F
notes: Semi-aquatic - spends most time in water but needs dry basking area
Can grow 8-12 inches as adults - requires large tank
Long lifespan commitment - can live 30-40 years
Aquatic species - requires specialized turtle tank setup

warnings.message: UVB lighting is essential for shell health and calcium metabolism. Use UVB 5.0 tube over basking area.
Grows large (8-12 inches) and lives 30-40 years. Small tanks cause shell deformities. Plan for 120+ gallon tank as adult.
Can carry Salmonella - always wash hands after handling or cleaning tank. Not recommended for young children.

feedingRequirements: Omnivorous - commercial turtle pellets as staple
Supplement with leafy greens, insects, small fish
Juveniles more carnivorous, adults more herbivorous
feedingSchedule: Juveniles (0-2 years): Daily, protein-rich diet with some vegetables
Sub-adults (2-5 years): Every other day, balanced diet
Adults (5+ years): 2-3 times weekly, primarily vegetables with occasional protein
waterNotes: Water depth should be 1.5-2x turtle's shell length
Powerful filtration required - turtles are messy
Maintain water temperature 75-80¬∞F with submersible heater
mistingNotes: Focus on maintaining water quality and basking area
Basking area must be completely dry with heat lamp and UVB
